name: Class Viewer for Java

screenshots.caption: all public methods with "char" and showing right-click dropdown menu
JApplet class public fields, which are all inherited
Exceptions search and showing dropdown automatically stores full classname

short_description:
Java class overview tool with a focus on ease of use. Why figure out a tool when you just want to work? Gives a full overview of a class, from its public methods, constructors and fields to its superclass and interfaces. 

Uses your preferred browser--set it using a text editor in ClassViewerConfig.xml--to open javadocs right to the method with a double-click.

Looking over your own code? Can open with your preferred text editor. And can open to the method if your text editor supports a line number as an argument, which gedit does so highly recommend it. 

That's a fun feature.

Configured by an XML file. Is a stateless app.

Download includes: ClassViewer.jar and ClassViewerConfig.xml
 
Can be run from the jar. Run unpacked from the jar from the command line, for classpath and local file access. No installer used or included.
summary: See and search public methods. See public constructors and fields.
